alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 27 at 8:51PM MST until December 28 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW FOR THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS TONIGHT... .Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers will continue across the higher terrain tonight. Mountain roads will remain snow covered and slick. Blowing and drifting snow can be expected over the higher passes and above timberline. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow will be heavy at times. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches by Tuesday morning. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions due to snow covered roads and poor visibility in snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
